method.title: Studying
method.openquestion: If you had an easier time learning, or could remember what you've learned for longer, how could that change your life?
method.closedquestion: When you need to study, what technique do you use the most?

food.title: Nutrition
food.openquestion: How could you improve your diet?
food.closedquestion: Do you think that your current diet is healthy?

sleep.title: Sleep
sleep.openquestion: What helps you get a good night's rest?
sleep.closedquestion: How many hours of sleep do you need a night?

mentalWorkload.title: Mental Workload
mentalWorkload.openquestion: What can you do to cut off sources of distraction in your work or study?
mentalWorkload.closedquestion: How many balls can you juggle at once?

profiles.title: Learning Profiles
profiles.openquestion: Have you ever run into problems when working with people of different learning profiles?
profiles.closedquestion: What elder are you the closest to in terms of learning profile?

stress.title: Stress
stress.openquestion: When you're stressed, what can you do to relax?
stress.closedquestion: How often do you find yourself stressed out?

organisation.title: Organization
organisation.openquestion: What do you do to organize your work, when you have lots of tasks?
organisation.closedquestion: Do you work or study on the weekend?
organisation.answer2: Only if I absolutely have to
organisation.answer3: The weekend, the night, the dayâ€¦ it's all the same

success.title: Success
success.openquestion: Beyond work and study, what goals to you have for your life?
success.closedquestion: What is your relation to success?
success.answer1: Strategic - I do as much or as little as needed to get the top grades
success.answer2: Comprehensive - It's the learning that counts, not the diploma
success.answer3: Instrumental - I just need to get the degree
success.answer4: Relative - I want to do as well as my peers
